meanings.definition: The quality of being interesting or important enough to be reported in the news.
meanings.sent1: The newsworthiness of the event led to its coverage on all major news channels.
meanings.sent2: The newsworthiness of the story attracted a lot of attention from journalists.
meanings.sent3: The newsworthiness of the cat chasing its tail made it to the front page of the newspaper.
meanings.sent4: Her newsworthiness in the community was like a shining beacon of information.
meanings.sent5: The newsworthiness of the discovery was so compelling that it became the headline of every newspaper.

meanings.definition: The state of being considered worthy of coverage by the media.
meanings.sent1: The newsworthiness of the celebrity's scandal made it a hot topic for tabloids.
meanings.sent2: The politician's newsworthiness increased after the controversial speech.
meanings.sent3: The newsworthiness of the dog's birthday party amused the local news team.
meanings.sent4: Her newsworthiness in the industry was like a magnet for journalists.
meanings.sent5: The newsworthiness of the event was so undeniable that it made headlines worldwide.
